qas.question: What is another term for the Amazigh?
What language did the Berbers living in the Nafusa Mountains not speak?
On what date did the NTC government enter the Arab League?
What were the last two cities to be controlled by Gaddafi's government?
What organization provided air support to the Libyan rebels?

context: Now with <a4_0>NATO<a4_0/> support in the form of air cover, the rebel militia pushed westward, defeating loyalist armies and securing control of the centre of the country. Gaining the support of Amazigh (<a0_0>Berber<a0_0/>) communities of the Nafusa Mountains, who had long been persecuted as non-<a1_0>Arabic<a1_0/> speakers under Gaddafi, the NTC armies surrounded Gaddafi loyalists in several key areas of western Libya. In August, the rebels seized <a3_0>Zliten and Tripoli<a3_0/>, ending the last vestiges of Gaddafist power. On <a2_0>25 August<a2_0/>, the Arab League recognised the NTC to be "the legitimate representative of the Libyan state", on which basis Libya would resume its membership in the League.
